name: Time COMP
description: The Time Component allows each component to have its own timeline (clock). The Time Component contains a network of operators that can drive a Timeline, drive animations in Animation COMPs, or be used to drive any custom time-based system. The Time Component's parameters define the speed, range, various options for the time system.
summary: The Time Component allows each component to have its own timeline (clock). The Time Component contains a network of operators that can drive a Timeline, drive animations in Animation COMPs, or be used

parameters.name: Play
parameters.label: Play
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
The Time  allows each component to have its own timeline (clock). The Time  contains a network of operators that can drive a Timeline, drive animations in Animation COMPs, or be used to drive any custom time-based system. The Time 's parameters define the speed, range, various options for the time system.  		
The Time  is often used in TouchDesigner to allow a component to have its own timeline / clock, this is called Component Time. It is useful for holding some parts of your system stationary while others are allowed to play forward. A Time 's location must be in the /local network of a Component for the Time  to create a  Time. 			
To add  Time to a component, right-click on the component and select Add  Time... from the popup menu, this will add the following Time  /comppath/local/time.			
The Time 's predefined network is Cloned from Master  /sys/local/time.  The Time 's network can be modified if the path in the  parameter is removed.
timeCOMP_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 





  play - Controls the playback of the Time . 0 = stop, 1 = play.


		
  rate - Sets the frame per second for the Time .


		
  start - Sets the start frame for the Time . The Start and End parameters determine the overall length of the Time .


		
  end - Sets the end frame for the Time . The Start and End parameters determine the overall length of the Time .


		
  rangelimit -  - This menu controls how the playback loops:

 loop - The timeline will loop when it reaches Range End frame. hold - The timeline will stop (hold) when it reaches Range End frame.
		
  rangestart - Sets the start frame of the working range. The working range is a subset of the start/end range which can be used to focus work on a smaller section of time. The playhead will only playback the frames/beats that are inside this working range.


		
  rangeend - Sets the end frame of the working range. The working range is a subset of the start/end range which can be used to focus work on a smaller section of time. The playhead will only playback the frames/beats that are inside this working range.


		
  resetframe - Place holder to specify which frame to jump to (Obsolete).


		
  signature -  - Specifies the time signature. The first number is the number of beats per measure and the second number indicates the type of note that constitutes one beat. See Time Signature - Wikipedia for additional information.

signature1 -signature2 -
		
  tempo - Sets the bpm for the Time .


		
  independent - When checked on, this Time 's time will not be dependant on parent Time Components found in the network hierarchy. For example, starting/pausing other Time 's higher in the hierarchy will not start/pause a Time  whose Run Independently parameter is on.





The  parameter page sets the component's python extensions.  Please see extensions for more information.

  ext - Sequence of info for creating extensions on this component



  ext0object - A number of class instances that can be attached to the component.


    
  ext0name - Optional name to search by, instead of the instance class name.



  ext0promote - Controls whether or not the extensions are visible directly at the component level, or must be accessed through the .ext member.  Example:  n.Somefunction vs n.ext.Somefunction




  reinitextensions - Recompile all extension objects. Normally extension objects are compiled only when they are referenced and their definitions have changed.





The Common parameter page sets the component's node viewer and clone relationships.

  parentshortcut - Specifies a name you can use anywhere inside the component as the path to that component. See Parent Shortcut.



  opshortcut - Specifies a name you can use anywhere at all as the path to that component. See Global OP Shortcut.



  iop - Sequence header for internal operators.



  iop0shortcut - Specifies a name you can use anywhere inside the component as a path to "Internal " below. See Internal Operators.



  iop0op - The path to the Internal OP inside this component. See Internal Operators.




  opviewer - Select which operator's node viewer to use when the Node View parameter above is set to Operator .



  enablecloning - Control if the OP should be actively cloneing. Turning this off causes this node to stop cloning it's ' Master'.



  enablecloningpulse - Instantaneously clone the contents.



  clone -  to a component used as the Master Clone.



  loadondemand - Loads the component into memory only when required. Good to use for components that are not always used in the project.



  enableexternaltox - When on (default), the external  file will be loaded when the  starts and the contents of the  will match that of the external . This can be turned off to avoid loading from the referenced external  on startup if desired (the contents of the  are instead loaded from the  file). Useful if you wish to have a  reference an external  but not always load from it unless you specifically push the Re-Init Network parameter button.



  enableexternaltoxpulse - This button will re-load from the external  file (if present).



  externaltox -  to a  file on disk which will source the component's contents upon start of a . This allows for components to contain networks that can be updated independently. If the  file can not be found, whatever the  file was saved with will be loaded.



  reloadcustom - When this checkbox is enabled, the values of the component's Custom Parameters are reloaded when the .tox is reloaded. This only affects top-level parameters on the component, all parameters on nodes inside the component are always reloaded with the .tox.



  reloadbuiltin - When this checkbox is enabled, the values of the component's built-in parameters are reloaded when the .tox is reloaded. This only affects top-level parameters on the component, all parameters on nodes inside the component are always reloaded with the .tox.



  savebackup - When this checkbox is enabled, a backup copy of the component specified by the External  parameter is saved in the  file.  This backup copy will be used if the External  can not be found. This may happen if the  was renamed, deleted, or the  file is running on another computer that is missing component media.



  subcompname - When loading from an External  file, this option allows you to reach into the  and pull out a  and make that the top-level , ignoring everything else in the file (except for the contents of that ). For example if a  file named project1 contains project1/geo1, putting geo1 as the Sub- to Load, will result in geo1 being loaded in place of the current . If this parameter is blank, it just loads the  file normally using the top level  in the file.



  relpath -  - Set whether the child file paths within this  are relative to the  itself or the , or inherit from parent.

 inherit - Inherit setting from parent. project - The path, when specified as a relative path, will be relative to the  file. externaltox - The path, when specified as a relative path, will be relative to the  file. When no external  file is specified, or when Enable External  is not toggled on, this doesn't have any impact.



Extra Information for the Time  can be accessed via an Info CHOP.


 - - - - - - - - -
 - Number of children in this component.
 - Number of times the operator has cooked since the process started. - Duration of the last cook in milliseconds. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the component timeline. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the absolute time. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator started cooking in the frame it was cooked. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator finished cooking in the frame it was cooked. - 1 if operator was cooked this frame. - Number of warnings in this operator if any. - Number of errors in this operator if any.
TouchDesigner Build: Latest\nwikieditor2021.100002018.28070before 2018.28070
COMPs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

An Operator Family that contains its own Network. There are sixteen 3D Object Component and ten 2D Panel Component types. See also Network Path.



Cloning makes multiple components match the contents of a master component. A Component whose Clone parameter is set will be forced to contain the same nodes, wiring and parameters as its master component. Cloning does not create new components as does the Replicator COMP.



The term "Frame" is a measurement of time used (1) in the Timeline, (2) as a time-unit in CHOPs, and (3) as a time unit in movie files that are read into TOPs and written out from TOPs. The frame rate is the frames per second (FPS).



An Operator Family that contains its own Network. There are sixteen 3D Object Component and ten 2D Panel Component types. See also Network Path.



Any component can be extended with its own Python classes which contain python functions and data.



The sub-Family of Component types that are used to define and render 3D scenes. A Geometry Component is an Object that contains the 3D shapes to render. A Camera COMP and Light COMP are other Object types. Separately, "Objects" also refers to Python objects.



A Parent Shortcut is a parameter on a component that contains a name that you can use anywhere inside the component to refer to that component using the syntax parent.Name, for example parent.Effect.width to obtain panel width.



A name for a component that is accessible from any node in a project, which can be declared in a component's Global Operator Shortcut parameter.



Any of the procedural data operators. OPs do all the work in TouchDesigner. They "cook" and output data to other OPs, which ultimately result in new images, data and audio being generated. See Node.



Operator shortcuts are Python objects that return operators (or sometimes parameters). These include Parent Shortcuts for accessing a component from within that component, and Global OP Shortcuts that access a unique component from anywhere in TouchDesigner.



The viewer of a node can be (1) the interior of a node (the Node Viewer), (2) a floating window (RMB->View... on node), or (3) a Pane that graphically shows the results of an operator.



To "pulse" a parameter is to send it a signal from (1) an exported CHOP channel or (2) a python command or (3) a mouse click that causes a new action to occur immediately. A pulse via python is via the .pulse() function on a pulse-type parameter, such as Reset parameter in a Speed CHOP. A pulse from a CHOP is typically a 0 to 1 to 0 signal in an exported channel.



The location of an operator within the TouchDesigner environment, for example, /geo1/circle1, a node called circle1 in a component called geo1. The path / is called Root. This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



TouchDesigner Component file, the file type used to save a Component of your TouchDesigner project.



TOuch Environment file, the file type used by TouchDesigner to save your entire project.



There are 2 kinds of parenting. The "parent component" is the component in which a node resides. The metaphor is extended to include grand parents, grand-grand parents, etc. The root / is the ultimate parent to all nodes. See also 3D Parenting and panel Parenting.



An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Time_COMP&oldid=30718"
		Category: COMPs

Any component can be extended with its own Python classes which contain python functions and data.



The sub-Family of Component types that are used to define and render 3D scenes. A Geometry Component is an Object that contains the 3D shapes to render. A Camera COMP and Light COMP are other Object types. Separately, "Objects" also refers to Python objects.



A Parent Shortcut is a parameter on a component that contains a name that you can use anywhere inside the component to refer to that component using the syntax parent.Name, for example parent.Effect.width to obtain panel width.



A name for a component that is accessible from any node in a project, which can be declared in a component's Global Operator Shortcut parameter.



Any of the procedural data operators. OPs do all the work in TouchDesigner. They "cook" and output data to other OPs, which ultimately result in new images, data and audio being generated. See Node.



Operator shortcuts are Python objects that return operators (or sometimes parameters). These include Parent Shortcuts for accessing a component from within that component, and Global OP Shortcuts that access a unique component from anywhere in TouchDesigner.



The viewer of a node can be (1) the interior of a node (the Node Viewer), (2) a floating window (RMB->View... on node), or (3) a Pane that graphically shows the results of an operator.



To "pulse" a parameter is to send it a signal from (1) an exported CHOP channel or (2) a python command or (3) a mouse click that causes a new action to occur immediately. A pulse via python is via the .pulse() function on a pulse-type parameter, such as Reset parameter in a Speed CHOP. A pulse from a CHOP is typically a 0 to 1 to 0 signal in an exported channel.



The location of an operator within the TouchDesigner environment, for example, /geo1/circle1, a node called circle1 in a component called geo1. The path / is called Root. This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



TouchDesigner Component file, the file type used to save a Component of your TouchDesigner project.



TOuch Environment file, the file type used by TouchDesigner to save your entire project.



There are 2 kinds of parenting. The "parent component" is the component in which a node resides. The metaphor is extended to include grand parents, grand-grand parents, etc. The root / is the ultimate parent to all nodes. See also 3D Parenting and panel Parenting.



An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Time_COMP&oldid=30718"

parameters.name: Play
parameters.label: Play
parameters.description: play - Controls the playback of the Time . 0 = stop, 1 = play.

parameters.name: Rate
parameters.label: Rate
parameters.description: rate - Sets the frame per second for the Time .

parameters.name: Start
parameters.label: Start
parameters.description: start - Sets the start frame for the Time . The Start and End parameters determine the overall length of the Time .

parameters.name: End
parameters.label: End
parameters.description: end - Sets the end frame for the Time . The Start and End parameters determine the overall length of the Time .

parameters.name: Range Limit
parameters.label: Range Limit
parameters.description:
rangelimit -  - This menu controls how the playback loops:

 loop - The timeline will loop when it reaches Range End frame. hold - The timeline will stop (hold) when it reaches Range End frame.

parameters.name: Loop
parameters.label: Loop
parameters.description: loop - The timeline will loop when it reaches Range End frame. hold - The timeline will stop (hold) when it reaches Range End frame.

parameters.name: Range Start
parameters.label: Range Start
parameters.description: rangestart - Sets the start frame of the working range. The working range is a subset of the start/end range which can be used to focus work on a smaller section of time. The playhead will only playback the frames/beats that are inside this working range.

parameters.name: Range End
parameters.label: Range End
parameters.description: rangeend - Sets the end frame of the working range. The working range is a subset of the start/end range which can be used to focus work on a smaller section of time. The playhead will only playback the frames/beats that are inside this working range.

parameters.name: Reset Frame
parameters.label: Reset Frame
parameters.description: resetframe - Place holder to specify which frame to jump to (Obsolete).

parameters.name: Signature
parameters.label: Signature
parameters.description:
signature -  - Specifies the time signature. The first number is the number of beats per measure and the second number indicates the type of note that constitutes one beat. See Time Signature - Wikipedia for additional information.

signature1 -signature2 -

parameters.name: Tempo
parameters.label: Tempo
parameters.description: tempo - Sets the bpm for the Time .

parameters.name: Run Independently
parameters.label: Run Independently
parameters.description: independent - When checked on, this Time 's time will not be dependant on parent Time Components found in the network hierarchy. For example, starting/pausing other Time 's higher in the hierarchy will not start/pause a Time  whose Run Independently parameter is on.

parameters.name: Extension
parameters.label: Extension
parameters.description:
ext - Sequence of info for creating extensions on this component



  ext0object - A number of class instances that can be attached to the component.


    
  ext0name - Optional name to search by, instead of the instance class name.



  ext0promote - Controls whether or not the extensions are visible directly at the component level, or must be accessed through the .ext member.  Example:  n.Somefunction vs n.ext.Somefunction

parameters.name: Object
parameters.label: Object
parameters.description: ext0object - A number of class instances that can be attached to the component.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.label: Name
parameters.description: ext0name - Optional name to search by, instead of the instance class name.

parameters.name: Promote
parameters.label: Promote
parameters.description: ext0promote - Controls whether or not the extensions are visible directly at the component level, or must be accessed through the .ext member.  Example:  n.Somefunction vs n.ext.Somefunction

parameters.name: Re-Init Extensions
parameters.label: Re-Init Extensions
parameters.description: reinitextensions - Recompile all extension objects. Normally extension objects are compiled only when they are referenced and their definitions have changed.

parameters.name: Parent Shortcut
parameters.label: Parent Shortcut
parameters.description: parentshortcut - Specifies a name you can use anywhere inside the component as the path to that component. See Parent Shortcut.

parameters.name: Global OP Shortcut
parameters.label: Global OP Shortcut
parameters.description: opshortcut - Specifies a name you can use anywhere at all as the path to that component. See Global OP Shortcut.

parameters.name: Internal OP
parameters.label: Internal OP
parameters.description:
iop - Sequence header for internal operators.



  iop0shortcut - Specifies a name you can use anywhere inside the component as a path to "Internal " below. See Internal Operators.



  iop0op - The path to the Internal OP inside this component. See Internal Operators.

parameters.name: Shortcut
parameters.label: Shortcut
parameters.description: iop0shortcut - Specifies a name you can use anywhere inside the component as a path to "Internal " below. See Internal Operators.

parameters.name: OP
parameters.label: OP
parameters.description: iop0op - The path to the Internal OP inside this component. See Internal Operators.

parameters.name: Operator Viewer
parameters.label: Operator Viewer
parameters.description: opviewer - Select which operator's node viewer to use when the Node View parameter above is set to Operator .

parameters.name: Enable Cloning
parameters.label: Enable Cloning
parameters.description: enablecloning - Control if the OP should be actively cloneing. Turning this off causes this node to stop cloning it's ' Master'.

parameters.name: Enable Cloning Pulse
parameters.label: Enable Cloning Pulse
parameters.description: enablecloningpulse - Instantaneously clone the contents.

parameters.name: Clone Master
parameters.label: Clone Master
parameters.description: clone -  to a component used as the Master Clone.

parameters.name: Load on Demand
parameters.label: Load on Demand
parameters.description: loadondemand - Loads the component into memory only when required. Good to use for components that are not always used in the project.

parameters.name: Enable External .tox
parameters.label: Enable External .tox
parameters.description: enableexternaltox - When on (default), the external  file will be loaded when the  starts and the contents of the  will match that of the external . This can be turned off to avoid loading from the referenced external  on startup if desired (the contents of the  are instead loaded from the  file). Useful if you wish to have a  reference an external  but not always load from it unless you specifically push the Re-Init Network parameter button.

parameters.name: Enable External .tox Pulse
parameters.label: Enable External .tox Pulse
parameters.description: enableexternaltoxpulse - This button will re-load from the external  file (if present).

parameters.name: External .tox Path
parameters.label: External .tox Path
parameters.description: externaltox -  to a  file on disk which will source the component's contents upon start of a . This allows for components to contain networks that can be updated independently. If the  file can not be found, whatever the  file was saved with will be loaded.

parameters.name: Reload Custom Parameters
parameters.label: Reload Custom Parameters
parameters.description: reloadcustom - When this checkbox is enabled, the values of the component's Custom Parameters are reloaded when the .tox is reloaded. This only affects top-level parameters on the component, all parameters on nodes inside the component are always reloaded with the .tox.

parameters.name: Reload Built-In Parameters
parameters.label: Reload Built-In Parameters
parameters.description: reloadbuiltin - When this checkbox is enabled, the values of the component's built-in parameters are reloaded when the .tox is reloaded. This only affects top-level parameters on the component, all parameters on nodes inside the component are always reloaded with the .tox.

parameters.name: Save Backup of External
parameters.label: Save Backup of External
parameters.description: savebackup - When this checkbox is enabled, a backup copy of the component specified by the External  parameter is saved in the  file.  This backup copy will be used if the External  can not be found. This may happen if the  was renamed, deleted, or the  file is running on another computer that is missing component media.

parameters.name: Sub-Component to Load
parameters.label: Sub-Component to Load
parameters.description: subcompname - When loading from an External  file, this option allows you to reach into the  and pull out a  and make that the top-level , ignoring everything else in the file (except for the contents of that ). For example if a  file named project1 contains project1/geo1, putting geo1 as the Sub- to Load, will result in geo1 being loaded in place of the current . If this parameter is blank, it just loads the  file normally using the top level  in the file.

parameters.name: Relative File Path Behavior
parameters.label: Relative File Path Behavior
parameters.description:
relpath -  - Set whether the child file paths within this  are relative to the  itself or the , or inherit from parent.

 inherit - Inherit setting from parent. project - The path, when specified as a relative path, will be relative to the  file. externaltox - The path, when specified as a relative path, will be relative to the  file. When no external  file is specified, or when Enable External  is not toggled on, this doesn't have any impact.

parameters.name: Use Parent's Behavior
parameters.label: Use Parent's Behavior
parameters.description: inherit - Inherit setting from parent. project - The path, when specified as a relative path, will be relative to the  file. externaltox - The path, when specified as a relative path, will be relative to the  file. When no external  file is specified, or when Enable External  is not toggled on, this doesn't have any impact.
